trans-unit.source: Controls how Unicode characters are output by the <xref href="System.Net.WebUtility.HtmlEncode*"></xref> methods.
For more information on how Unicode characters are supposed to be encoded in HTML, see [Using character escapes in markup and CSS](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=256607).
The Unicode encoding behavior is determined by current application's target Framework.
For [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)] and later, the Unicode encoding behavior is strict.
Specifies that individual UTF-16 surrogate code points are output as-is when one of <xref href="System.Net.WebUtility.HtmlEncode*"></xref> methods is called.
For example, given a string "\uD84C\uDFB4" (or "\U000233B4"), the output of <xref href="System.Net.WebUtility.HtmlEncode*"></xref> is "\uD84C\uDFB4" (the input is not encoded).
Specifies that individual UTF-16 surrogate code points are combined into a single code point when one of the <xref href="System.Net.WebUtility.HtmlEncode*"></xref> methods is called.
For example, given the input string "\uD84C\uDFB4" (or "\U000233B4"), the output of the <xref href="System.Net.WebUtility.HtmlEncode*"></xref> methods is "𣎴".
If the input is a malformed UTF-16 string (it contains unpaired surrogates, for example), the bad code points will be replaced with U+FFFD (Unicode replacement char) before being HTML-encoded.
